elements.title: Mecodema howittii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ground beetle Mecodema howittii (pictured), only known to be found on Banks Peninsula in New Zealand, is in decline?

elements.title: Devonshire Lodge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prior to becoming prime minister of Canada, Paul Martin frequently searched the basement of Devonshire Lodge for a bootlegging tunnel?

elements.title: traverse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the world's longest continuous rock climbing route is a horizontal 4,500-metre (14,800 ft) traverse on El Capitan, according to Guinness World Records?

elements.title: Robert Diouf (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic wrestler Robert Diouf twice defeated an opponent who was nearly 20 kilograms (44 lb) heavier than him?

elements.title: Byrnihat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Byrnihat was ranked by an air technology company as the world's most polluted city in 2024?

elements.title: murder of Mark Carson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2013 murder of Mark Carson, a hate crime involving the killing of an openly gay man, took place less than a quarter-mile (400 m) from the Stonewall Inn?

elements.title: Fort Duvernette (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fort Duvernette played a role in saving the survivors of a 1795 Carib attack on a British supply convoy?

elements.title: a plane crash (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a plane crash was watched in real time by a bedridden woman through her mirror?

elements.title: decided to rebel against the emperor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Prince of Ning decided to rebel against the emperor right after his birthday party?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Parahyangan

The West Javanese region centred around Java's third largest city of Bandung is an excellent place to hike and admire active volcanoes.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Rail travel in Great Britain

200 years ago, on 27 September 1825, the first ever passenger train ran between Stockton-on-Tees and Darlington. Since then, the rail network in Great Britain has become one of the world's densest and most well-utilised systems.
